column4: hey guys, is there a way to share out your entire local X session on ubuntu?
vino is there by default already
although I prefer tightvnc or freenx
I have used it a good amount
it is way better than vnc
what exactly do you wnat to do ? If you are in KDE obviously you would expect to be sharing KDE ?
I want to share out my entire graphical session
or do you want to run a different desktop?
GNOME has vino server as I said
xtightvnc will create a new session if that's what you need
you can create a new session (sort of like screen) that can be called remotely
xtightvnc seems to be what I want
sounds like it - and it works with the KDE remote client
right - xtightvnc is the server daemon
